results.title: Germaine Greer's Sydney
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
A look at Sydney with Germaine Greer. She comments on it being a city “where the poorest people can be millionaires. Where, for practically nothing, you can do the same things that in other countries you have to join select clubs to do.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions

results.title: Peter Ustinov's Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Presents Peter Ustinov’s personal view of Leningrad. He briefly relates the city’s history, showing many of the buildings - St. Peter and St. Paul Cathedral, the Imperial Winter Palace, St. Isaac’s Cathedral, amongst many others. He discusses many aspects of the arts, literature, music ballet and drama of Leningrad.

results.title: Drought grips Riverina
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel (Ep. 679) consisting of one “full-reel” item: “Drought grips Riverina”, alerting the public to the severity of the drought, and criticising the destructive abuse of the land by farmers who overstock. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Moresby under the blitz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel. This issue is a film by Damien Parer of the war in New Guinea, including his dramatic footage of the bombing of the Macdhul.

results.title: R.A.N. ashore and afloat: it's the navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
Special 1000th issue of Cinesound Review devoted to the Royal Australian Navy; the Senior Service. Class room training and recruitment is put to good use aboard the H.M.A.S. Latrobe. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.

results.title: Kokoda front line!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly news magazine (No. 568) produced by Cinesound in Sydney. This edition consists of one ‘fullreel’ item - “Kokoda Front Line” - by Damien Parer about the war in New Guinea. Includes a discussion on jungle warfare and the servicing of Australian troops on the front line. Winner of an Academy Award in 1942. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
